menu.name: Koshari
menu.description: Egypt's national dish made of rice, lentils, pasta, and chickpeas topped with spicy tomato sauce and crispy onions.

menu.name: Ful Medames
menu.description: Slow-cooked fava beans seasoned with garlic, lemon, and olive oil, served with bread.

menu.name: Molokhia
menu.description: Jute leaf soup with garlic and coriander, served with rice or bread.

menu.name: Hawawshi
menu.description: Spiced minced meat stuffed in baladi bread, baked until crispy.

menu.name: Mahshi
menu.description: Vegetables stuffed with spiced rice, cooked in tomato sauce.

menu.name: Fatta
menu.description: Layered rice, bread, garlic meat broth, and lamb chunks.

menu.name: Taameya (Falafel)
menu.description: Fava bean patties with herbs, deep-fried, served with tahini.

menu.name: Shawerma
menu.description: Marinated beef/chicken grilled on a spit, served in bread with garlic sauce.

menu.name: Kofta
menu.description: Spiced ground meat skewers, grilled and served with bread or rice.

menu.name: Feseekh
menu.description: Fermented mullet fish, traditionally eaten during Sham El-Nessim festival.

menu.name: Umm Ali
menu.description: Egyptian bread pudding with milk, nuts, raisins, and coconut, baked to golden perfection.

menu.name: Basbousa
menu.description: Semolina cake soaked in sweet syrup, often topped with almonds or coconut.

menu.name: Konafa
menu.description: Shredded phyllo pastry filled with cream or cheese, baked and drenched in syrup.

menu.name: Qatayef
menu.description: Mini pancakes stuffed with nuts or cream, fried or baked, then dipped in syrup.

menu.name: Mahalabia
menu.description: Milk pudding flavored with rose water or orange blossom, topped with pistachios.
